intro: Teucrium euganeum, commonly known as the Italian germander, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in whorled clusters at the ends of the branches. Teucrium euganeum is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and grasslands.
